title: Thuso Phala
text:
Thuso Phala (born 27 May 1986 in <a href="Soweto">Soweto</a>, <a href="Gauteng">Gauteng</a>) is a South African <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a> who plays for <a href="Premier%20Soccer%20League">Premier Soccer League</a> club <a href="Black%20Leopards%20F.C.">Black Leopards</a>. He is the inventor of <a href="Thuso%20Phala%20dance%20moves">Thuso Phala dance moves</a> that are becoming popular to South African soccer fans and dancers at large, the moves he makes after he scores a goal.
Phala was featured in a BBC documentary in 2004 entitled 'Football and Freedom' which followed the paths of two 13-year-old South Africans aiming to become professional footballers.
International career.
Since making his debut for the <a href="South%20Africa%20national%20football%20team">South Africa national football team</a> in 2010, Phala has appeared at both the <a href="2013%20Africa%20Cup%20of%20Nations">2013</a> and <a href="2015%20Africa%20Cup%20of%20Nations">2015</a> <a href="Africa%20Cup%20of%20Nations">Africa Cup of Nations</a>. He scored Bafana Bafana's opening goal of the 2015 tournament in a 3–1 loss to <a href="Algeria%20national%20football%20team">Algeria</a>.
